ZALEPLON

Indications and doses

Insomnia (short-term use),

By mouth

  • For adults
    10 mg daily for up to 2 weeks, dose to be taken at bedtime or after going to bed if difficulty falling asleep.
  • For adults elderly
    5 mg daily for up to 2 weeks, dose to be taken at bedtime or after going to bed if difficulty falling asleep.

Advice when patient is pregnant

Use only if necessary and restrict to occasional short-term use.

Risk of withdrawal symptoms in neonate if used in late pregnancy.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

Reduce dose to 5 mg.

Can precipitate coma.

Avoid if severe impairment.

Advice regarding renal impairment

Avoid in severe impairment.

Contra indications

  • Marked neuromuscular respiratory weakness
  • sleep apnoea syndrome
  • unstable myasthenia gravis

Known side effects

General side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: Amnesia, drowsiness, dysmenorrhea, paraesthesia,

uncommon: Anorexia, asthenia, confusion, depersonalisation, depression, disturbances of hearing, disturbances of smell, disturbances of speech, disturbances of vision, dizziness, hallucinations, impaired concentration, incoordination, nausea, photosensitivity,

notKnown: Paradoxical effects, sleep-walking,

Paradoxical effects

A paradoxical increase in hostility and aggression may be reported. The effects range from talkativeness and excitement to aggressive and antisocial acts. Adjustment of the dose (up or down) sometimes attenuates the impulses. Increased anxiety and perceptual disorders are other paradoxical effects. Increased hostility and aggression after barbiturates and alcohol usually indicates intoxication.

Advice for patients and carers

Patients should be advised not to take a second dose during a single night.

National funding/access decisions

NICE TA77

Zaleplon, zolpidem, and zopiclone for the short-term management of insomnia (April 2004)

Zaleplon is recommended for the short-term management of severe insomnia that interferes with normal daily life, and should be prescribed for short periods of time only.

www.nice.org.uk/TA77 www.nice.org.uk/TA77

Cautions regarding administration

  • Avoid prolonged use (risk of tolerance and withdrawal symptoms)
  • depression (risk of suicidal ideation)
  • history of alcohol abuse
  • history of drug abuse
  • muscle weakness
  • myasthenia gravis
  • respiratory insufficiency (avoid if severe)

Prepared medicinal forms of ZALEPLON

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Capsule
